Self-Managing Systems Designer & Facilitator at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.Read More

We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.

We're passionate about our work and are looking to find others who are interested in building solutions for an emerging, digitally-integrated economy. 

Please see our website for current opportunities. https://consensys.net/open-positions/

Applied
Apply to ConsenSys
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal.  Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About Organizational Development at ConsenSys

Consensys is developing itself as a self organizing system. ConsenSys believes that this is the only way we can be nimble and innovative enough to stay in the lead of the blockchain field. Project DNA combines our Organizational Development & Global Operations Circles. Our goal is to facilitate the development of a self-organizing ecosystem that is agile, scalable, representative and transparent. We coordinate the creation of the mindsets, structures and skillsets needed for self-organization at the individual, team, and company-wide level.

About the role

The Self-Management Facilitator/Systems Designer will be a key facilitator, thought leader and brand builder in improving our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized operating system. You will be instrumental in establishing the brand of the Organizational Development circle as a thought leader in decentralized systems of self-management. You will play an integral role as facilitator and coach to our people in their self-management journey. You will be a critical driver to our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized operating system.

The Organizational Development team is working to build out the operating system, training and skills building capability and education systems needed to build a decentralized, self-managed organization.  Because we are creating a self organizing system, this role requires facilitative leadership -- the ability to develop common vision among teams. Even though the role needs is senior level experience, it also requires the ability to follow the leadership from other team members. That element of culture fit is an essential aspect of this role.

Responsibilities

Work with the Organizational Development circle to identify high impact areas for change at the individual, team and system levels
Build hypotheses around these areas of change, design,develop and execute these experiments
Work with Organizational Development to facilitate the process of building self-organizing systems, practices, and mindsets at ConsenSys with teams, individuals and the company as a whole
Help build a diverse team to deliver and measure these experiments
Set up key metrics and feedback loops to be able to adapt the process as necessary
Build our brand through communication of learnings and case studies throughout the organization

Requirements

You have built effective systems of self-management in organizations or communities
Proven experience through case studies of building coalitions that have successfully reached their change goals
You care about doing high-leverage, impactful work in the world
Creating a system of organizing humans built foundationally in trust keeps you up at night or gets you up in the morning
Passionate about and have experience in building the “future of work”, e.g. Teal organizations, self-management, movement building
You are user-centered in your approach on everything
You take an Agile, experimental approach in problem-solving
Can communicate with stakeholders across many different businesses and international teams
Can build multicultural teams that are highly effective
Highly facilitative
Creative and innovative problem-solver
Able to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with teammates, community members, vendors, and partners
Comfortable with ambiguity, yet driven to create order out of chaos
Systems thinker, with ability to understand key business drivers that contribute to operational and financial success.
Demonstrated desire and drive to be a recognized thought leader within the larger Self-Management or Movement-Building community. An established network and positive brand are a plus.
Comfortable with working in a remote-first environment
Up to 30% travel

Experience with startups, or working at a non-traditional corporate organization or nonprofit is preferred.  Knowledge about blockchain & Ethereum is not required, but candidates should be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live, and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

Skills
Change Management, Building Coalitions, Organizational Development
Compensation
$135K–$145K

ConsenSys is a blockchain venture production studio building decentralized applications, mostly on Ethereum. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=32, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=60}
items.content:
HTML5 / Web Designer (React/Redux Pref.)

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Big Data, Developer APIs, Sports betting odds algorithms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Core Data | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
user-interface
html

Job description

This position is for a quick turnaround project for a highly skilled individual. If that's you and you have a portfolio to back that up, feel free to quote your hourly or project rate upfront.

Core Data currently needs an additional HTML5 web designer with react and redux experience to create a major expansion on the company's HTML5-based UI. The existing UI can be seen at this link. The existing UI is focused on displaying available offers for live (actively in play) sports games and uses a simplified navigation scheme where the user simply selects a sport, then a game, and ultimately selects what wagers are wanted.

The candidate will need to expand this User Interface to include "prematch" betting. Mockup designs for this have already been prepared here. The enhancement will keep all existing functionality of the live UI, but add a tab/screen for upcoming games that have not yet started. The list of available prematch games is numerous (sometimes in the thousands) and so the navigation scheme will be much more sophisticated than the live (current) navigation scheme. The company's goal is to have a clean, smooth, and intuitive cross-browser product.

The candidate will be expected to combine their knowledge of aesthetics and intuitive UX principles to create a cutting-edge, crisp, and attractive prematch expansion to the company's UI. The existing UI uses React.JS and Redux, so prior experience with these frameworks is necessary. The backend data to power the UI is provided vi a WebSockets feed and our backend team can make reasonable changes to the feed format if it is necessary to facilitate a speedy project completion.

Apply now

About Core Data

First and foremost, we are a software development company owned and operated entirely by professionals with a strong technical background.  Since technology is our core focus and software is our principal product, all projects at CDS are important and recognized by the highest levels of management.

We believe in hiring the best candidates for every position.  It is for this reason that we do not restrict ourselves to arbitrary geographical locations.  Most of our staff works on a remote basis.  Our hiring decisions are based on one's abilities, not location.

The projects we take on run the gamut.  Primarily we are a data and statistics provider with an emphasis on low-latency, real-time data feeds. 

Benefits

  • Monthly paid time off
  • Competitive Compensation

items.content:
XD Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: eLearning, Events
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: O'Reilly Media | No office location

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
design
adobe

Job description

About the Role

Reporting to the Lead Experience Designer, the Experience Designer (XD) collaborates with members of the Product, Engineering, and Creative teams to imagine and build user-centric learning experiences delivered via our online learning platform. Using a solve, learn, teach model, the platform helps individuals and teams find answers to in-the-moment technology challenges, develop deep expertise in hundreds of today's business and technology topics, and become highly-engaged life-long learners. The XD has a strong impact on how our millions of customers interact with learning experiences on our SaaS platform. The individual in this role will work as a team member in an agile squad supporting strategic projects. Candidates will apply design principles to assist various teams in producing clear and compelling visual communications.

About the O'Reilly Experience Design (XD) Creative Team

We are a hybrid (design and code) in-house agency, working on strategic XD projects across our online platform. We create user experiences that support and encourage learning for individuals and teams, across media, in alignment with the O'Reilly brand and our user’s desires.

In addition to XD product roadmap-driven sprints and ongoing day-to-day design support, we also collaborate with O'Reilly's marketing and creative teams. At its core, our creative team is focused on the delicate balance of ideas, aesthetics, messages, form, function—and brand. Because the best design is that which has a positive influence on the lives of our customers, we put understanding their needs and desires at the heart of everything we do.

About You

 As a Designer You Have:

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX experience designing large-scale (SaaS and/or ecommerce preferred) responsive products, high-content properties, and mobile applications for brands and/or media.
  • An analytical and visual mind, with a hunger for learning and a desire to solve complex human problems with technology.
  • Strong ability to refine designs through sketches, diagrams, wireframes, visual designs and interactive pieces.
  • A desire to challenge yourself both personally and professionally; as well as staying current with technology and interaction design trends.
  • Can-do attitude: accepts difficult challenges with curiosity, creativity, and dedication to craft. 

Role Responsibilities

Leverage core experience design and atomic design principles to weave iconography, typography, color, space, and texture together online to create an unparalleled learning experience on the O'Reilly platform.

  • Participate in user research and discovery on complex problems; speak with customers, get to know the problem space through research and iteration.
  • Design interfaces (and thus experiences) that inspire, engage, inform, and excite our customers.
  • Apply graphic and user-centered design principles to produce high-quality visuals—from concept to component-driven comps.
  • Collaborate with designers and creative team(s) across the company to continuously refine and center the O’Reilly design language, and create innovative, branded designs that people love viewing, using, and sharing with others.
  • Advocate for the user. Our users inform where we are going. Our teams focus on listening to users, and letting their needs guide us to the best solutions. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people.
  • Take full ownership of your work, and take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
  • Ability and willingness to communicate clearly with various stakeholders
  • Contribute to the evolution of the company's visual and experience style guide—including recommending data-inspired improvements and codifying usage rules on an ongoing basis.
  • Help build an exceptional XD team.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX design experience—preferably creating online learning related products
  • Online portfolio of work, demonstrating experience leading or managing the design of complex systems across multiple platforms, including mobile and touch-based interfaces.
  • Strong understanding of responsive design and web technologies.
  • Strong conceptualization and visual communication ability.
  • Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail.
  • Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps.
  • Expert knowledge of Sketch, Adobe CC Suite and associated design tools. Familiarity with HTML, CSS and JavaScript would also be helpful.
  • Proficient with user interface design patterns and standard user-centered design methodologies.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Understanding of common software product management practices.
  • Understanding of common software development practices.
  • Experience with inclusive and accessible design preferred.
Apply now

About O'Reilly Media

Inspiring the future for more than 40 years

We share the knowledge and teach the skills people need to change their world. For more than 40 years, O’Reilly has imparted the world-shaping ideas of innovators through books, articles, conferences, and our online learning platform.

When individuals, teams, and entire enterprises connect with the world's leading experts and content providers, anything is possible. Whether you're working to advance your career, be a better manager, or achieve the next breakthrough in technology or business, learning new skills is at the heart of it all.

With a range of formats including live online training courses, interactive tutorials, books, videos, and case studies, we equip all members of the workforce with the insight they need to stay ahead in an ever-changing economy.

Learning should not be measured in terms of usage, course completion, or certifications. Learning should be measured in terms of outcomes. We want to prepare people to solve challenging problems and inspire them with what’s possible for the future.  

Something we’ve been doing for over 40 years.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision insurance
  • Domestic partner coverage
  • Short and long-term disability insurance
  • Matching 401(k) plan
  • Paid time off for your birthday
  • Parental leave
  • Flexible sick time
  • Free O'Reilly books and subscription to learning platform
  • Flexible spending accounts

Technical Coach (Design)

Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin



Terms of Employment

items.title: Hireology: UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Hireology’s technology empowers businesses to build great teams.  Over the last seven years, we’ve grown from a startup to a market-leading organization with over 150 team members, and built an award-winning culture that makes this company an amazing place to work.

It’s with that in mind that Hireology is looking to add a UX Designer to our User Experience team.

As part of our UX team, you would be joining a small but passionate group of individuals who work daily to improve our user’s experience. We work with Product to help scope, design, and test new features and interfaces. We work with Engineering to help breathe life into those interfaces and bring them to our users. We work with Customer Success to understand and address existing pain points.

You’ll be tasked with understanding use cases, exploring innovative UI solutions, and identifying usability problems. Throughout the design process, you’ll create and communicate UX flows, develop mockups, and contribute to user personas. You’ll design clean, modern interfaces across different browsers and devices using the latest responsive methods. During all of this, you’ll participate in user testing sessions, continuing to refine the experience for our users.

Hireology is based in Chicago, but our Engineering and UX teams work remotely, so you’ll have the option of working from the comfort of your home or right in our office if you’re local. Compensation is competitive, and we offer a full benefits package. We have regular company-wide events, semi-annual team gatherings, and frequent celebrations when we hit our goals.

As one of our UX Designers, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Developing sketches, diagrams, and designs.
  • Collaborating with engineers, product managers, and users to deliver amazing experiences
  • Working closely with our Product Managers to solve business problems.
  • Advocating, designing, and planning qualitative and quantitative design experiments for our products
  • Being a user-advocate during the entire development process

So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? We have a pretty unique culture here at Hireology, and the person who will be successful in this role:

  • Considers User Experience as more than just aesthetics
  • Constantly searches for simplicity
  • Loves constructive criticism
  • Is obsessed with understanding the way people “work” and think
  • Is comfortable doing user research and intelligently integrating findings into your work
  • Has the ability to distill key issues from usability tests and implement practical solutions
  • Has the flexibility and agility to iterate or change design direction based on external feedback
  • Has a passion for design and great user experience
  • Works well both in a collaborative team environment and independently
  • Is a lifelong learner with a continuous eye for improving craft
  • Is a highly motivated self-starter with a positive attitude

Okay, we’ve laid out what the job is - now are you qualified? Below are the minimum qualifications we’re looking for in a UX Designer. Also, we want a chance to get to know who you are and why you applied, so please include a cover letter.

  • Three to six years of user experience or product design experience.
  • Experience designing complex web applications.
  • Strong knowledge of user experience design, information architecture, interaction design, and website development methodology.
  • Familiar with conducting user research.
  • A working understanding of personas, journey maps, and usability testing.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States.

So what can you expect after you apply? You will:

  • Take a brief true/false survey. Be sure to check your email after you apply.
  • Have a phone conversation with someone on our UX team. This is a high level conversation about you, but also a good opportunity for you to learn more about us.
  • Meet with our other UX Designers to talk shop. Be prepared to talk about how you approach work technically with examples of how you have done it in the past. No homework or on-the-spot assignments. We just want to nerd out a bit with you.
  • Go over your career history with our Senior Manager of UX. This will be an opportunity for us to get an idea of how you got to where you are, and if where you want to go lines up with where we are going.
  • Meet virtually with some more of the remote team. We want to give you some idea of the people you will be working with. We ask the serious questions here, like your top three movies.
  • Provide us some references. We use our automated reference check system for this, so you just give us some names, they fill out a survey, and we are all set.
  • Speak with a member of our leadership team. If you have made it this far, just be yourself, and everything will be fine.

Apply:

UX Designer at Exit Bee

We started as a SaaS service, we’re evolving into an innovative ad network. Using behavioural analysis and exit intent we’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising. We’re working hard to deliver value to our clients and partners. We’re on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.Read More

We started as a SaaS service, we’re evolving into an innovative ad network. Using behavioural analysis and exit intent we’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising. We’re working hard to deliver value to our clients and partners. We’re on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.

Having just completed our 2nd round of funding, we set new goals and aim high. We’re looking for talented, highly motivated people to join our growing team, think outside the box and create something great. Together.

Applied
Apply to Exit Bee
Add a message to Exit Bee
Apply

Job Description

As a UX Designer, you will be designing first-class user experience. You’ll be responsible for deeply understanding our users to design innovative product experiences that solve their problems. As part of the product team, you’ll be working closely with Product Managers and Engineers. We’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising so we expect you to come up with new campaign ideas and interactions to maximize campaign performance and ad ROI of our clients.

- Develop go-to-market plans for new product launches and ongoing product adoption initiatives
- Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your design
- Design and deliver wireframes, user journeys, and mockups
- Deliver final specifications and assets to development teams
- Measure UX success and iterating to achieve our business and user goals
- Participate in all phases of a product, from discovery to delivery to iteration
- Understand our client goals and come up with new campaign ideas to reach them
- Manage multiple projects

Skills
User Experience Design, User Interface Design, Agile, HTML5 & CSS3, Product Design

No Equity

What We're Building

Exit Bee is the first complete behavioral analysis and exit intent platform. We're on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.

With Smart Exit Ads we re-imagine what's possible in display advertising. From image and video ad campaigns to content, contests, lead generation and surveys, Smart Exit Ads maximize our clients' ad ROI. Our campaign viewability is double the viewability of an average banner ad and click-through rates are over 20 times higher.
We offer advertisers a new, premium and high-performing channel to reach their audience on trusted publishers.
We offer publishers a brand new revenue stream by monetizing a "part" of their website that remained unutilized.

With On-Site Retargeting we increase engagement, conversions and sales with tailored campaigns at the right time. Our clients use On-Site Retargeting to optimize their own website traffic by running behavioral, exit intent campaigns On-Site Retargeting is a SaaS product.

Frontend developer with UI/UX design experience at VisualCV

Vancouver, Remote · Full Time
VisualCV has helped over 1.5 million people make a career move. We are a platform to create and manage beautiful resumes, portfolios, and personal websites. After relaunching in June 2014, we have grown exponentially. Read More

VisualCV has helped over 1.5 million people make a career move. We are a platform to create and manage beautiful resumes, portfolios, and personal websites. After relaunching in June 2014, we have grown exponentially.

This is a temporary 1 year full-time role (maternity leave) that has high odds of turning into a long-term role. You will have the ability to make an impact on hundreds of thousands of users in your first few weeks by helping them get their next job or make a career change.

We're a small team who doesn't buy into the typical tech startup hype. We are profitable, growing, and believe in a healthy balance of a great life & great work. We're looking for the right person to join our tight team.

Applied
Apply to VisualCV
Add a message to VisualCV
Apply

Job Description

Why choose VisualCV?

Since launching in 2014, VisualCV has helped over 2 million people make a career move. We are a platform for individuals to create and manage beautiful resumes, portfolios, and personal websites. After launching in June 2014, we have grown exponentially (both in revenue and users), and were recently named #28 on Canada's Fastest Growing Startups list by McLeans Magazine and Canadian Business.

VisualCV is the flagship product of Workstory Inc. As our second engineering hire, you will have the ability to make an impact in your first few weeks by helping people land their next job or make a career change.

We're a small team who doesn't buy into the typical tech startup hype. We are profitable, growing, and believe in a healthy balance of a great life & great work. We're looking for the right person to join our tight team.

About the role:

We are hiring a front-end developer / designer with strong grasp of javascript, front-end frameworks and UI/UX design. Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS and JS is a must and if you are familiar with Rails and React.js it’ll be an advantage.

We are a small and agile team - you have a lot of responsibility to create products used by hundreds of thousands of people and see immediate impact from your work. We iterate fast and aim to push out product improvements every week.

Key Responsibilities:
- Improving our web and mobile experiences
- Product design and UX testing
- Designing and implementing new features

Skills:
- React.JS
- Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign, Sketch
- HTML, CSS
- Javascript

We focus on results, not hours. We are by in large a distributed team and while we are based in Vancouver we offer optional remote work.

To apply, send us your portfolio or resume. Better yet, try out visualcv.com and send us some feedback.

Skills
HTML, CSS, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Ruby on Rails, Sketch, React.js, AWS
Compensation
$75K–$100K

UX Designer at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different short film categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the short film festival circuit. We are planning for big expansions in the future into other languages. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

As Shortfundly’s Web Designer, you will have the opportunity to work across our web products including a video platform for audience and a content management system for creators. We looking to experiment on new engagement & retention techniques – so that will be something exciting & fun!

Your work will touch the lives of millions, and spread awesome short film from india to the world.

Responsibilities:
– Prototyping on photoshop
-- Familiar with wireframe tools.
-- Prototype & designing for web app
-- Prototype & designing for iOS and Andorid Mobile App
-- Prototype & designing for iOS and Andorid TV APP

General Skills :
– Have experience building Applications from ideation to Working Prototype

Experience – 0 to 2 years
Qualification – Doesn’t matter

Perks of working at Shortfundly:
– Watching video/ short films/ viral content is part of the job
– Interacting with filmmakers/ artists/ models is part of the job
– Discussing film stories/ brainstorming on scripts/ creating videos is part of the job

If you are interested, please write to: support@shortfundly.com with your brief self introduction, name and contact number. Share your linkedin profile .

UX Design Course Mentor (Part-Time/Flexible/Remote) at Springboard

Earth, San Francisco, Remote · Contract

✔ We’re driven by a big mission. Education is broken and we’re helping fix it. If successful, we will bring high quality yet affordable education to millions of people around the world.
✔ Our team is phenomenal, and we look out for each other. We genuinely care about your personal/professional growth.
✔ You'll have immense responsibility. We’ll give you a big mandate + resources, and let you run with it. You won't be micromanaged.
✔ You'll work closely with the founders, and help set strategy and direction.

Applied
Apply to Springboard
Add a message to Springboard
Apply

Job Description

(PLEASE APPLY HERE: https://goo.gl/WFXqJE)

We run an online, self-paced UX Design workshop where participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert mentor.

Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - has some of the best experts from the field. If you are as passionate about mentoring as you are about UX, and can give a few hours per week in return for an honorarium, we would love to hear from you.

Please find more details about the program below.

-- Completely online and self-paced. Coursework is ~100 hours and on average, students finish it in 2-3 months.
-- Participants in this course are working professionals and college students from all over the world, interested in getting started with UX Design.
-- Participants learn about UX with the help of a curated online curriculum, many projects and a personal mentor. They go through the curriculum at their own pace and have a weekly 30-minute checkin with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice!

What this means for mentors:

-- Mentors take out 30 minutes/mentee/week for a video chat, at a time of their convenience.
-- Most mentors take 4 mentees, but depending on your availability, you can commit to more or fewer.
-- We greatly value the mentors sharing their time and expertise, and arrange an honorarium per student per month.

Questions? Please write to us at mentors@springboard.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

(PLEASE APPLY HERE: https://goo.gl/WFXqJE)

items.title: SupportBee: Be our Designer Bee
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
Be our Designer Bee

Company: SupportBee
Headquarters: Earth
https://supportbee.com
SupportBee makes software for managing high touch customer relationships. We are bootstrapped, profitable, and hungry for growth, in business, and personal lives. Join us for a rewarding journey! 

Why SupportBee

Tech-focused
We pride ourselves on the quality of our tech stack and strive to maintain it. One of the founders wrote a ton of the early code and shaped the tech culture. We have been practicing test-driven development since we started in 2011 and we have written a lot about our tech stack and delivered several talks on it as well. Everyone in the company is comfortable using a text editor and the command line and focuses on improving workflows - whether they relate to customer support or server infrastructure. 

Data-driven
We use Mixpanel and Google Analytics to track an array of events and properties on the app’s usage. With this rich usage data flowing in, we can answer questions about feature usage, and identify companies that are using specific features (or not using them).  It helps us improve the product and avoid working on ideas with little ROI. We have a data-driven culture — as a team, we rely on data to drive decisions about the product.

Deep domain expertise
We have been working on SupportBee since 2011. We launched the product in September 2012. Since then we have learned a ton about our domain — problems customers face, technical challenges in solving them, and ways to monetize effectively (aligning value provided with monetization strategies). Customer support is a complex domain and working with a deep understanding of the domain is fun and rewarding. It lets us tackle complex problems and build creative solutions. 

Remote Work Culture
We don’t have an office, and all of us join in from around the world. Currently, we are from Bolivia, Europe, United States, and India. All we require is a great internet connection, a few hours of overlap with the team, and presence in the daily standup meeting at 9am EST. Our work happens on Github, Trello, and Slack and we believe in the power of asynchronous, and clear written communication.

A culture based on respect and acceptance
We founded the company first and foremost to be a great place to work. We wanted to create a workspace where we would enjoy working every day. That goal is more important to us now than ever before. We value diversity - our team comes from many different parts of the world. Founded by two women, we have had several women contribute to the company over the last decade. A company's culture is a living thing and forever evolving. Ours isn't perfect, and we want you to help us shape it. 

The road ahead is exciting
While customer support is a crowded space, ticketing hasn't inherently changed in the last decade or two. With our domain understanding, we want to create a new kind of customer support software, and we want you to be a part of this exciting journey.  We'll talk more about this when we chat with you. 

Your Role
You’ll be working on both the product and our marketing efforts. On the product side, your day to day work will involve creating mockups for new features or improvements, designing them (we love sketch) and giving feedback to the development team as they implement your designs. You’ll also be working on customer support (we all do) to learn from customers and get a first hand feel for SupportBee.

On the marketing side, you will help us create a stronger brand and tell a better story. You will also work on improving our style guides. We use them to drive both the product and the marketing. All of us want to become better at designing experiences and we would love to learn from you.

Finally, we want to scale up our design team and you’ll be helping us attract and hire great designers. This would involve writing about the design process at SupportBee, and sharing your work with the world (dribbble, talks, and interviews etc). 

What we are looking for

* 3+ years of experience designing web & mobile applications
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills (in English)
* Experience in designing UI/UX for rich web applications. 
* Experience with Semantic UI (we use it extensively)
* Experience in writing SCSS and a sound understanding of HTML.
* Some experience with Javascript or the willingness to learn it (so you can understand our stack and the build process etc).
* A passion for details (like micro-interactions) and shipping improvements to customers.

What we are offering

* $35K - $45K salary per year (USD).
* 0.1 - 0.5% stock options vested over four years with a one year cliff.
* Any hardware or software that you need to excel at your job.

Apply for this position

We want to see examples of your work and want to understand your design philosophy. Send an email to hello@supportbee.com with the subject - "Designer - Weworkremotely". Please attach links to your work and answers to a few questions* Send us a few ideas for our app after taking a look at it (we offer a 14 day trial so you can use that)* What SaaS apps do you find the most interesting? Why?* If you could build anything, what would it be?Send us a book recommendation and tell us why you picked that one.

items.title: Instructional Designer - Pearson - Cheyenne, WY
items.content:
Instructional Designer

Company: Pearson
Location: Cheyenne, WY
**Description**

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

The Instructional Designer is responsible for the development and revision of curricular products for Pearson partners/clients. This position works directly with subject matter experts, partner/client personnel, quality assurance staff, and multimedia developers. The Instructional Designer will work as an integral part of a collaborative instructional design team responsible for the assessment, design, development, and evaluation of online, hybrid, and/or traditional courses and learning experiences. This individual will conceptualize and storyboard instructionally sound, interactive, engaging web-based course components and input these components into learning management systems.

Responsibilities:
Manages the curriculum development process for new and revision courses and learning experiences and assures that courses adhere to partner/client standards.

Develops and supports partner/client-chosen online learning environments.

Provides instructional design consultation to faculty of partners/clients and/or subject matter experts; assists faculty of partners/clients and/or subject matter experts in the development of contextually-rich, engaging, and objective-driven courses and learning experiences that focus on applicable real-world/workplace skills.

Works within a project management application to document course development process data including time tracking, project comments, and task completion.

Designs content for delivery in online environments and completes instructional design documentation to ensure quality and consistency.

Conducts photo research for images to supplement learning activities.

Uses WYSIWYG multimedia tools to develop multimedia pieces.

Communicates regularly with partner/client faculty and/or subject matter experts during curriculum development process.

Builds course content/components into the learning management system.

Conceptualizes and storyboards instructionally sound, interactive, engaging web-based course components.

Conducts quality assurance reviews on courses and implements revisions. Collaborates with quality assurance staff.

Reviews existing courses for quality, currency, and consistency and works with faculty to enhance curriculum design as needed.

Participates in university ID team meetings.

Helps to test and implement agreed-upon emerging technologies in courses and learning experiences.

Prepares course hand-off documentation, facilitators’ guides, etc., and attends hand-off meetings with the Student Support Services and Help Desk teams.

Attends course revision calls and creates scope documents outlining confirmed revisions from post-course discussions.

**Qualifications**

+ Bachelor’s degree in education, instructional design, curriculum, educational technology, or a related degree is required; master’s degree is preferred.

+ Minimum of three years’ experience in instructional design with experience in designing authentic assessments and generative learning experiences. Experience in higher education is preferred.

+ Knowledge of adult learning principles, Understanding by Design, constructivism, facilitation, and learner-centered activities.

+ Ability to provide instructional design consulting services to subject matter experts.

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

+ Experience in learning management systems and html, with knowledge of accessibility standards.

+ Ability to be creative, flexible, and innovative in course design.

+ Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, adhere to budgets, and meet deadlines.

+ Exceptionally strong attention to detail.

+ Comfort in working within project management applications.

Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

**Job: ** Product Management

At Vocatio we're a startup committed to making a huge innovation and social impact around career discovery, exploration and preparation for students of all types from 16-25 yrs old. On the flip side, businesses of all types need young entry-level talent (including us @ Vocatio) to improve their competitiveness. However, finding young "talent that fits" with the unique dynamics of each company is a huge challenge and the resulting "mishires" cost companies more than $15B each year.

(3) match students with employer opportunities via a proprietary career readiness & engagement algorithm.

VOCATIO integrates career Curriculum, Content & Community programming through a beautifully designed mobile & web platform to lifecycle students through career discovery, exploration, readiness and advancement.

After facilitating meaningful and measurable career engagement among students, the resulting data is captured & leveraged through a proprietary career alignment algorithm to personalize and match student career profiles to job roles, industries, & employer opportunities of all types – internships, contractor/project-based work, and part-time and full-time jobs.

items.content:
UX Designer (APAC)

Company: In Marketing We Trust

Is user behavior at the heart of everything you do?
Do you like to reveal these insights to improve content, design and strategic decisions?
Do you want to join a team that embraces remote working?

Due to In Marketing We Trust’s tremendous growth, we are looking for a skilled UX Designer to create amazing experiences for our clients' websites and mobile apps. You will manage the delivery of UX project deliverables for specific clients and projects. 

Your focus will be on translating high-level client needs into specific UX designs and ensuring that the work is done with efficiency, effectiveness and quality.
Here Is What You Need To Succeed
You are used to leading discovery, as well as design activities. You must be able to bring (client) stakeholders along the journey and provide compelling user insights at every stage of discovery and design.
 
You are passionate about working collaboratively with your team members to help define and implement end-to-end customer experiences that deliver tangible business results.

  • You ideate, explore and collaborate on user-centric concepts, prototypes, wireframes, user journeys, mock-ups and UI visuals to explore a range of solutions.
  • You have experience running or participating in UX insight activities, such as; user research, ideation sessions, usability testing, co-creation workshops, stakeholder interviews.
  • You facilitate user testing, obtaining and analysing quantitative and qualitative feedback.
  • You actively contribute to a remote work culture where your collaborative approach, communication skills and gravitas are at the heart of the client's requirements.

Your Experience
You have experience as a UX Designer, working in a web and app environment to create interactive prototypes, wireframes, work-flow storyboards, journey maps, mock-ups and UI outputs.

  • You have the ability to work autonomously, whilst quickly and efficiently gathering and distiling complex requirements.
  • You are familiar with agile methodology and iterative design processes.
  • You have demonstrated interest in good UX & UI design, and what this means for both the end user and service provider.
  • You are proficient in using popular UX tools such as Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe suite.
  • You have an understanding of core digital technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Javascript iOS and Android.
  • You have experience of working on web comparison services and conversation rate optimisation (a plus).
  • You maintain awareness of latest technologies, software, hardware, best practices and developments within the UX and design community.
  • You have excellent written and spoken communication skills; the ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to wide and varied.

Duration
Project base (20-25 hours per week), with potential to go 'permanent' part-time.

What We Offer You
A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you an unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.
How to apply:
If you can see yourself in this remote role and feel you can add to the ongoing success of In Marketing We Trust, then apply via - www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au/about/careers/

Rebrandly is the easiest way to create, share and manage branded links. We offer companies and individuals the possibility to brand and shorten the links they share using a custom domain name of their choosing. We want to optimize the way people share the information they value.Read More

Rebrandly is the easiest way to create, share and manage branded links. We offer companies and individuals the possibility to brand and shorten the links they share using a custom domain name of their choosing. We want to optimize the way people share the information they value.

At Rebrandly, we believe that our customers’ brands come first. Behind every click, tap or swipe there’s a link; and we are committed to putting control over those links into our customers’ hands. Rebrandly is trusted by top brands all over the world, including Heineken, Land Rover, Expedia, Harvard and Ernst & Young.

Our tight-knit team shares a passion for technology and a drive for rapid growth. We’re diverse, with teammates spread across 4 continents, who speak 11 different languages and practice 6 different religions. Our main offices are in Dublin, Rome and Chisinau and we also embrace remote work. Our culture is transparent, and it’s based on focus, growth, creativity, collaboration and progression.

Want to join a goal-oriented team in a fast-paced tech startup? We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking individuals who really believe in our project and can help bring our vision to life. If that’s you, get in touch today!

items.content:
Full-time

(Ann Arbor, Michigan)

Hey, there. We’re thrilled you’re interested in reading about this opportunity to join our team of WordPress experts and artists. 3.7 Designs has been in operation for 13 years–12 of which have been spent designing and building WordPress websites and premium WordPress products. We’re a small agency with a family atmosphere. We have flexible and remote working arrangements so you can focus on balancing amazing work and personal life.

 

We’re looking for a highly skilled, enthusiastic WordPress Developer to join our growing company.

 

The ideal candidate would share our core values and have the following characteristics:

 

  • Integrity
  • Attention to detail
  • Excellent digital, written, and verbal communication
  • Self motivation and top-notch time management skills
  • A love for learning and improvement
  • Proactive
  • Efficient
  • Easy going
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
  • Ability to figure out complex problems and come up with an ideal approach to building new features
  • Great troubleshooter
  • 3-5 years of building custom WordPress themes
  • Loves clean, beautiful code

 

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

  • Taking PSD files and converting them into responsive WordPress websites
  • Building custom, full-featured WordPress themes from scratch
  • Building custom WordPress functionality using actions, filters, ajax, custom queries, custom post types, taxonomies, etc...
  • Configuring WordPress plugins
  • Launching websites
  • Communicating with clients
  • Building and iterating on our premium WordPress products

 

Qualifications:

  • Solid knowledge of JavaScript, PHP, WordPress, responsive design and HTML/CSS/SCSS
  • Ability to setup and work from local environments
  • Expert at hand-coding custom themes based on design mockups
  • Familiar with cPanel/WHM administration
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Patience--aka not grumpy :-)

 

Other important details:

Graphic design skills are not required; however, a keen eye for design and understanding of usability best practices are big pluses.

 

Perks

 

  • Flexible hours and schedule
  • Majority remote work (we have an office but typically only work there once or twice a week)
  • 35-hour work weeks
  • 10 days paid vacation
  • 13 paid holidays
  • Healthcare stipend
  • Education stipend
  • Family atmosphere
  • Focused on personal development
  • Free lunch Friday
  • A team you want to wake up and work with everyday

Local candidates preferred, but open to remote workers:

  • Ann Arbor, Michigan

items.title: UX Design Course Mentor (Part-Time/Flexible/Remote)
items.content:
UX Design Course Mentor (Part-Time/Flexible/Remote)

Remote

full-time

Springboard runs an online, self-paced UX Design workshop in which participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert mentor. Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - comprises some of the best experts in the field.

If you are as passionate about mentoring as you are about UX, and can give a few hours per week in return for an honorarium, we would love to hear from you.

Please reach out to us with any questions at mentors@springboard.com :-)

The Program
  • Completely online
  • Self-paced
  • Students learn the fundamentals of UX with the help of a curated online curriculum and project-based deliverables
  • Coursework is ~100 hours
  • On average, students finish in 2-3 months
  • Students are working professionals and college students from all over the world, interested in getting started with UX Design
  • Students have a weekly 30-minute checkin with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice!
You:
  • Are as passionate about teaching design as about design itself
  • Are proficient in the topics covered in our UX Design workshop
  • Have at least 2 years of relevant work experience, and a handsome portfolio to show for it
  • Are available for weekly, 30-minute video check-ins with students to help them set and achieve learning goals, answer subject matter questions, provide feedback on projects, and offer career advice
  • Are empathetic and have excellent communication skills
Benefits:

items.content:
Period
Tentatively 2 Weeks - consultation meeting prior to starting to finalise timeline
Monday July 30th - August 10th with potential for extension

About us

FollowApp.Care is a healthcare technology company specialising in AI-driven patient communications. We collect patient-generated health data prior to or after a procedure in order inform treatment, care decisions, drive quality and generate actionable performance reports. Our current customers are healthcare providers in the Australian, American, and European regions.

We are a small team based in London with some remote team members currently. We have plans to expand very quickly with the help of several more contracts underway and plans for investment.

We are currently in the development and planning phase of the next version of our product, which you will be a key member in contributing to the process!

You will be responsible for...

Working closely with the product team to understand and critically analyse the current web platform (what works, what doesn’t)
Produce UX deliverables, including workflows, interfaces, wireframes, and visual designs
Turning design ideas and wireframes into to-spec mock ups for the developers to create

You will need ….

At least 1 year of UI/UX design experience is desirable
A portfolio of your past UI and UX work
Photoshop, Illustrator, and or other wireframing or visual designing tools
Clear and strong knowledge of best practice for Ux on mobile and desktop
Feel comfortable asking questions and working in a team
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
High attention to detail
Nice to have - understanding or history of working in the healthcare space

The location
Located conveniently in East Central London, right by Liverpool St station, we are in a co-working space (WeWork) where unlimited coffees, biscuits, and beer are just some of the perks!

Interested?
Get in touch and apply to find out more about us!

items.title: Head Illustrator & Concept Artist
items.content:
Who We Are

The Urban Cowgirl provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create story-driven instructional courses to educate and empower Amazon Sellers to scale their business with Amazon Advertising. We are a service business, partnering with our clients to scale their businesses and achieve their desired outcomes. We immerse ourselves in advanced advertising strategy. We are always learning and growing.

Who You Are

You’re confident in your ability to illustrate and design sequential artwork. This includes character illustrations and hand-drawn elements based on collaborative storyboards. You’re interested in Spaghetti Western films and have experience creating artwork based on classic Western characters and themes. You have the ability to work efficiently as part of a team, take direction, and deliver assets on deadline in a fast-paced environment.

We’re currently using an Adobe Illustrator-based workflow focused on silhouette treatments. We’re looking for someone who can mimic our existing art style and lead the transition into a new art style with fresh concepts. We’ve been working with a freelance graphic artist that relies heavily on the Image Trace feature in Illustrator. We’re looking to create a full-time position for a highly talented artist with more advanced character drawing and illustration skills.

 

Responsibilities:

- Use Illustrator or Photoshop to produce Spaghetti Western themed silhouettes in a noir style

- Collaborate with the creative team remotely via Slack and email

- Manage asset workflow between the Storyline Designer, Graphic Designer, and Subject Matter Expert to finalize sequential assets

 

Requirements:

- Strong working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Adobe Creative Suite

- Experience collaborating with creative teams of 3 or more people

- Strong time management and organization skills

- Critical thinking skills to generate original and innovative ideas

- Skilled at identifying challenges and proactively creating solutions

- Experience creating multiple drafts and refining your work to achieve excellence

- Digital storytelling and content creation experience a plus

 

Essential Software Experience:

Adobe Illustrator (5+ years)

Adobe Photoshop (5+ years)

Adobe Creative Suite

The Urban Cowgirl values loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement.

items.title: UX/UI Designer
items.content:
UX/UI Designer

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Design / Product Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a designer to join our growing team to create exciting design work to be used for our blockchain platform and our media channels. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights and other team member inputs to produce relevant material.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone to take charge of our design operations and help us expand our digital footprint. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in producing various designs which promote user engagement.

Daily Operations:

  • Design graphics content for different social media platforms.
  • Designing interfaces for web/mobile apps;
  • Create visuals for marketing material and other media.
  • Graphic design and visual style-related tasks;
  • Creation of methodologies and specifications for usability testing;
  • Prototyping;
  • Prepare charts and infographics for Akropolis material.
  • Optimize website design: page mapping, active elements design etc
  • Working with marketing and technical team.

Previous experience/skills:

  • Knowledge of the principles of web/mobile app usability;
  • Knowledge of the principles of creating/drawing functional sketches, graphics etc.;
  • Ability to work comfortably with the necessary graphics software;
  • Understanding of usability testing principles, creation of testing methodologies, results analysis;
  • Project development experience and a deep insight into user interfaces based on a variety of platforms;
  • Ability to argue one’s case and visualise ideas;
  • Fluent spoken and written English;
  • Working with legacy: ability to maintain the consistency with works of previous designers;
  • Experience working with startups, preferably in the Crypto space;
  • Project development experience and a deep insight into user interfaces based on a variety of platforms.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pension, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

We’re looking for a confident, experienced, and talented graphic designer with strong interests and capabilities in the design and development of engaging user experiences. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to focus on minimal, clean, and thoughtful user interfaces, while also ensuring that graphic elements are used intentionally to enhance the customer’s experience.

With over 10,000 Shopify merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge, your talents will be the creative force behind an up and coming brand and empower thousands of online stores and hundreds of thousands of shoppers.

Does this sound like you?

  • You thrive at providing both highly analytical and highly creative ideas to a design engagement.
  • You’re self-driven, great at running with ideas and executing them independently.
  • You’re resourceful: you figure out what needs to be done, and you find ways to make it happen.
  • You thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills.
  • You're independent, with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.
  • You work with a sense of urgency and get things done.
  • You believe in what we’re doing and you’re excited to help ReCharge grow.

Responsibilities:

  • Each day will be a new design/creative challenge on a variety of projects from branding and layouts to presentations and web design.
  • Create web graphics and marketing collateral consistent with our brand image
  • Solving design problems while wearing multiple hats
  • Collaborate with the marketing team and the front end engineers to launch projects
  • Design blog and email campaign assets weekly

Requirements:

  • 4+ years experience in a similar role at a B2B SaaS company
  • Experience in internal marketing organizations or marketing/advertising agencies
  • Expertise with industry leading software (Adobe Creative Cloud - Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator; Sketch)
  • Experience in a fast-paced and innovative development environment is essential.
  • Thorough understanding of contemporary user-centered design methodologies is a must.
  • A deep understanding of the end to end iterative UX process, including personas, scenarios, wire-framing, and high fidelity visuals.
  • A keen eye for good design, attention to detail and soft spot for the end user; advocating for them in all areas of your work is core to what you do.
  • Basic understanding of Javascript, HTML, CSS.

About ReCharge:

We have two missions at ReCharge: make it easy for people to sell subscription products online, and make our company an amazing place to work. The first mission began as three people working out of a small apartment, trying to solve one of the biggest problems facing Shopify merchants: recurring payments. Now we’re at the forefront of recurring billing software, empowering thousands of entrepreneurs to sell their products as subscriptions, and processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week.

Our culture is remote-first and we stay connected every day using Slack and video chat. Being part of a small, fast-growing company is exciting: the opportunities to grow and take ownership at ReCharge are endless and we’ll make sure you have everything you need to do your best work and make a big impact.

 

ReCharge is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Job Perks: Work Remotely, Health Benefits, Bi-annual Retreat, Unlimited PTO

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Series Eight is a small, remote digital product studio with a team spanning across the UK and Europe. We are design driven — from complex user flows and experiences to beautiful creative animation pieces, Series Eight works with a collection of international clients from a range of industries.

We are are at an exciting stage in our development, having made it through our formative years (with a few awards in tow ) we are ready to put down some roots, define our processes, build a culture and create a world class fully remote team.

We are looking for an enthusiastic UX/UI Designer to work alongside the team of designers and developers who will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects for startups, brands and organisations.

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Knows Sketch like the back of your hand
  • Have a genuine passion for solving problems and improving user experiences
  • A good understanding how websites work and design in a functional manner for development
  • Able to work on projects from ideation to launch
  • Able to pitch ideas and discuss design thinking
  • A keen eye for typography and attention for detail
  • A self starter and efficient with time
  • A great collaborator and communicator with team members and clients (this is extra important with us being a remote studio)
  • You really want to join our team!

Bonus Points if:

  • You know how to code up a simple prototype
  • You can animate your UI to showcase motion for the development team and for clients.

Perks:

  • Work from anywhere
  • Be part of an awesome, collaborative team
  • Remote team-building events
  • Personal time for personal projects
  • A budget for learning

Want to learn more? Email us at jobs@serieseight.com with your CV and links to your portfolio, dribbble, behance, codepen

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Job description
We are looking for a passionate Lead Games Artist to design and lead the development of our game platform. If you love to stay on top of cutting-edge technologies and want to create a revolutionary product with us. If you seek an opportunity to make a direct impact in the industry, shine within the company and with outside stakeholders. There is no limit to your role, except your own ambition.
You will be a valued member of the core team and take part in all high-level decision making. You will be responsible for the games tech side and in charge of making it happen. You will follow your passion, be present in the struggle and own a part of the success.
We value attitude, mentality and cultural fit over experience; however previous experience in a startup is a big plus.
Some people need to be told exactly what to do, and when. If you are not one of these people and you have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset, you are a risk taker who wants to shape the growth of a disruptive business in gaming, then we have got the perfect opportunity for you!
Our offices are located in London and Athens. Mainly you will work remotely, however face to face meetings are required following business needs.
We also strive for that great balance of being a team that feels like a family. That means we share feedback regularly, support each other's self-improvement efforts and personal plans, and see honest mistakes as opportunities to learn together.

Skills
A degree or HND in an art subject, such as fine art, graphic design or illustration. 2D, art tools, especially PhotoShop. Would be nice: 3D art tools, especially Maya.
Benefits
Flexible working hours. Work the hours that make you more happy and productive, keeping in mind time-zones and work deliverables. Simultaneously learn and contribute, while working with big studios and indie developers. You will get the opportunity to work with the best, take on a lot of responsibility and grow.
Compensation
Stock Options program. Joining the Conclify core team, means you are entrusted to own part of the company.

Job Responsibilities

In charge of all visual aspects, branding and the look and feel of both Conclify and our games.
In charge of the production or selection of mockups and any visual or game assets.
You will hold the leading role in the game production process.
You will be brain storming and developing ideas, for new features and content.
You will contribute to the creation of new concepts and pitches.
Make tough decisions while being aware of the impact on the business.
Develop and manage Conclify's game developers' network.

Required Skills

Have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset.
Very high levels of enthusiasm, energy and passion for games, games development and a good understanding of what makes a game visually appealing and fun to play.
Be proactive, self-motivated and able to inspire and motivate a team of creative talents.
Can-do attitude with speed and product in mind.
Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks.
Strong interpersonal and written communications ability and skills.
Business mindset. Decision making. Problem solving.
Have a team-oriented attitude and analytical mind.
Have a distinctive and original style.
Demonstrate a desire to learn and grow professionally.
Be able to take criticism and feedback on your ideas, take a step back and then iterate, but at the same time have confidence in your ideas, i.e. a balance of humbleness to accept feedback of others with confidence in your thinking.
Experience working in agile and rapid prototyping.
Extensive knowledge of (mobile) games.
Strong attention to detail (UI, animation, sound effects, etc.)
Would be nice: Knowledge of the Unity, Unreal game engines & HTML5.
Would be nice: Creative in new game concepts.
Would be nice: Understanding of free-to-play gaming and best practices in this domain.
Have an online art portfolio. (include the URL in your submission)
